comments: // A JSON record can have any name, and any extension (such as .txt or .json). For example, CO2AdsorptionNaX.json. The top level title field defines which schema to use. The user can create custom fields to store additional information. Remember to add a comma at the end of any fields added.
title: CO2_Adsorption_Isotherm

data.comments: // The curly bracket starts a data series. A file can have more than one data series. The uid is an optional unique ID and can even be a doi, for example.  The name field is the name of the series and will appear in the legend.
data.name: CO2 Adsorption on NaX, K_eq = 99.6 (1/bar)

simulate.comments: // The model field allows description of whether it is an elementary step model or some other kind of model. In this case, the model is a Langmuir_Isotherm model. This model requires having *either* K_E or k_ads and k_des.  The fields of k_f and k_r will only be checked if the K_E  has null as its value. The units of pressure must be expressed with a division symbol like 1/bar.

data.comments: // The curly bracket starts a data series. A file can have more than one data series. The uid is an optional unique ID and can even be a doi, for example.  The name field is the name of the series and will appear in the legend.
data.name: CO2 Adsorption on NaX, K_eq = 109.6 (1/bar)

simulate.comments: // The model field allows description of whether it is an elementary step model or some other kind of model. In this case, the model is a Langmuir_Isotherm model. This model requires having *either* K_E or k_ads and k_des.  The fields of k_f and k_r will only be checked if the K_E  has null as its value. The units of pressure must be expressed with a division symbol like 1/bar.

layout.comments: // The title field of the layout is the title of the graph (not of a series).
layout.title: CO2 Adsorption

xaxis.comments: // The x axis title must include the units that are expected.
xaxis.title: CO2 Pressure (kPa)

yaxis.comments: // The y axis title must include the units that are expected.
yaxis.title: CO2 Adsorbed (mol/kg)
